wikipedia_page.main: Major-General George Handcock Thesiger  (6 October 1868 – 27 September 1915) was a senior officer in the British Army during the First World War who was killed in action during the Battle of Loos by German shellfire. His career had encompassed military service in Egypt, South Africa, Ireland, British India and  France and had been rewarded with membership in two chivalric orders.
